p: Bacillus species are commonly associated with food from animal sources that is considered a public health threat. The highest prevalence of Bacillus spp. was observed in processed meat, especially beef burger. Essential oils and spices powder of certain medicinal plants (black seeds: Nigella sativa, cloves: Syzygium aromaicum, cinnamon: Cinnamomum zeylanicum, and Marjoram: Origanum majorana) have a potential in vitro antimicrobial activity against Bacillus spp. Furthermore, Nigella sativa oil exhibited the most potent antibacterial activity against Bacillus spp., while Cumin ( Cuminum cyminum) showed the least antibacterial activity.
